title: Business & Finance
text:
The transparency of the recent social-media-fueled stock-trading frenzy poses a test for regulators considering whether there was any manipulation in the market.

---

Apple's talks with Hyundai have broken down without an agreement for the South Korean auto giant to assemble vehicles for the iPhone company.

---

Elliott has been meeting with bankers about raising more than $1 billion for a special purpose-acquisition company.

---

Firms are withholding more of top officers' pay for longer, hoping to avoid the hassle of recouping money if and when executives are later found responsible for misconduct.

---

Walmart will acquire technology from Thunder, which uses automation to create digital ads.

---

Zoom Video announced new features aimed in part at helping IT leaders manage the health and safety of employees who are gradually returning to the physical office.
